timeline.bodyText: Does customer need to explicitly specify LOCAL in versionRequirement?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: No, customer doesn't need to. We use LOCAL group for local development, the target components of LOCAL group mean they are local override, so keep using local available version.
replies.author: wikimonkey

timeline.bodyText: If other group contains a component that's not in the deployed group, will this be also marked as target?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: Yes, the purpose of these piece of code is to retrieve the other groups' target components. They should be resolved (including their dependencies) and running on the device at the time.
replies.author: wikimonkey

timeline.bodyText: componentNameToVersionConstraints doesn't have the deployment doc added yet. Why can you resolve component dependencies here? What if the versionConstraints of a component in deployment doc is conflicting with other component version requirement?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: For the other groups, their dependencies should already be resolved and running on the device. The purpose of this iteration is to 1) build component to version requirements map because current deploying group can have common dependencies with the other groups; 2) get the other groups' resolved version because dependency resolver is supposed to return the full list of components.
replies.author: wikimonkey

timeline.bodyText: Is this the entire recipe content string match? Will version check be simpler?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: It needs to do content comparison because private registry name occlusion feature - private is same version as public, but private needs to replace public.
replies.author: wikimonkey

replies.bodyText: It also has the additional benefit (implicitly) to recover mutated/corrupted recipe...
replies.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: I'd prefer jsonNode object comparison. But that can be implemented later
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.bodyText: What is the sort based on?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: based upon semver ordering implemented in Semver4j library which will ensure 1.10 > 1.9 :)
replies.author: wikimonkey

replies.bodyText: Default sort is ascending order, so the latest version would be last. Is that what you are expecting?
replies.author: MikeDombo

replies.bodyText: I want descending order. I think you override ComponentIdentifier::compareTo method, so now it's sorted in descending order.
replies.author: wikimonkey

timeline.bodyText: Does it mean findComponentRecipeContent() can return file name instead of file content?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: As mentioned above, it needs content comparison to support name occlusion feature.
replies.author: wikimonkey

timeline.bodyText: Just to point out that this changes from the existing behavior for "currently running version will be retained". The new behavior for currently running version might not be retained - depend on cloud's result. I think that's what we want (so that transitive dependencies could be auto bumped for newer version within the specified version range...) Just double check on this change of behavior
timeline.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: yes, that is what we want. By launch, we have the process alway trying to update to the latest versions of dependencies. Next, we will consider adding options to let customer keep the existing running version.
replies.author: wikimonkey

timeline.bodyText: Sorry didn't thought about when looking at the code yesterday - should we just skip calling cloud if it's a builtin service?
timeline.author: leaf94

replies.bodyText: I am thinking if it has recipes in cloud, it could be updated.
replies.author: wikimonkey

timeline.message:
Publish as public component, Fix error in "startup" based service if it errors after RUNNING (#468)

* Publish as public component

* If startup script fails after reporting running, it should still go to error

Add TelemetryAgent service (#378)

* Implemented emission, aggregation and publish of metrics.
* Beta 1 metrics - System metrics , kernel component state metrics
* Unit tests and Integration tests

wait till the publish interval to check the periodic metrics future s… (#474)

* wait till the publish interval to check the periodic metrics future status

* assert non null on periodic metrics future

Adding retry for Iot Jobs subscriptions (#462)

Co-authored-by: Michael Dombrowski <mdombro@amazon.com>

getIotClient(awsRegion, stage, credentialsProvider) API (#470)

* getIotClient(awsRegion, stage, credentialsProvider) API

* region and docstring

* common implementation for all getIotClient APIs

* throw URISyntaxException

* number of retries

Co-authored-by: Michael Dombrowski <mdombro@amazon.com>

Making cli_ipc_info readable only for the owner (#471)

Co-authored-by: Michael Dombrowski <mdombro@amazon.com>
temporarily lower integ test coverage ratio since the new DR process is not integrated into deployment flow yet

timeline.bodyText: NIT: add a comment. requirementMap is a groupId->requirement map
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.bodyText: How is this different from findActiveAndSatisfiedPackageMetadata?
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: this returns component identifier, no need to read recipe from file. findActiveAndSatisfiedPackageMetadata  will be cleaned out once we made the switch.
replies.author: wikimonkey

replies.bodyText: Ok. you can add @deprecated on findActiveAndSatisfiedPackageMetadata later
replies.author: ShirleyZheng92

timeline.bodyText: This can be in the platform resolver class. Also add a TODO to add osVersion
timeline.author: ShirleyZheng92

replies.bodyText: I would rather keep it here because ComponentPlatform is GCS coral object. Will add comment.
replies.author: wikimonkey
